entry.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18864)
entry.content:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!

Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry

  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

entry.title: "In the two years since Aurora police and paramedics...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In the two years since Aurora police and paramedics encountered Elijah McClain ‚Äî which resulted in the 23-year-old's death ‚Äî Colorado has moved to hold police accountable through laws, courts and investigations, as McClain and other Black people around the country have died at the hands of law enforcement."

Herod, a key force behind SB 217, said in a Sunday tweet honoring Sheneen McClain, "We are not done. The fight continues."

Colorado Politics

In the two years since Aurora police and paramedics encountered Elijah McClain ‚Äî which resulted in the 23-year-old's death ‚Äî Colorado has moved to hold police accountable through laws, courts

Two years after Elijah McClain's death, investigations, legislation and lawsuits move state forward

entry.title: "State Rep. Leslie Herod has led the charge on police...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"State Rep. Leslie Herod has led the charge on police reform in Colorado and said she would consider looking at legislative changes to make a misdemeanor like the one Haubert was charged with a reason to disqualify someone from becoming POST certified to be a police officer.

‚ÄúIt's definitely something that I will look into, but what I think is more important right now is that our law enforcement agencies need to do an audit of their staff, of their law enforcement,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm concerned that there are more officers like this that continue to be on the streets in Colorado,‚Äù Herod said."

Aurora leaders say its Civil Service Commission, which oversees hiring of police officers, needs an overhaul. The outcry comes after a former Aurora police officer was seen on body camera video pistol-whipping and choking a suspect. The officer had a previous criminal record but was still hired.

thedenverchannel.com

City leaders say Aurora‚Äôs Civil Service Commission, process for new police hires needs to change

Aurora leaders say its Civil Service Commission, which oversees hiring of police officers, needs an overhaul. The outcry comes after a former Aurora police officer was seen on body camera video pistol-whipping and choking a suspect. The officer had a previous criminal record but was still hired.Aurora leaders say its Civil Service Commission, which oversees hiring of police officers, needs an overhaul. The outcry comes after a former Aurora police officer was seen on body camera video pistol-whipping and choking a suspect. The officer had a previous criminal record but was still hired.

DENVER (August 23, 2021) -- Colorado Creative Industries, a division of the Colorado Office of Economic Development and International Trade (OEDIT), announced today that applications are open for the Colorado Arts Relief Fund for Individuals and the Colorado Arts Relief Fund for Businesses and Organizations.

‚ÄúAccording to Americans for the Arts research, 72 percent of Americans believe ‚Äòthe arts unify our communities regardless of age, race, sexual orientation... and ethnicity‚Äô and 81 percent say the arts are a ‚Äòpositive experience in a troubled world‚Äô,‚Äù said Representative Leslie Herod. ‚ÄúThis program helps Colorado‚Äôs creative sector endure while preserving our vibrant reputation as a great place to live, visit, and do business. I‚Äôm grateful to my colleagues Senators Jaquez Lewis and Buckner and Representative Benavidez for joining me in championing this second round of funding.‚Äù

entry.title: ‚ÄúSheneen found herself in a position she never dreamed would...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúSheneen found herself in a position she never dreamed would happen ‚Äî she was speaking to legislators about laws and testifying before committees about what happened to her son.

Her voice was powerful, said state Rep. Leslie Herod, D-Denver.

‚ÄúWe need real-life experiences to shape public policy,‚Äù Herod said. ‚ÄúHer truth and honesty and her passion were important to pass that bill.‚Äù

entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúColorado law now requires law enforcement officers to stop other officers from using excessive force, or report it after it happens.

Otherwise, it is a crime.‚Äù

entry.title: Recently preliminary redistricting maps were released for...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Recently preliminary redistricting maps were released for Colorado‚Äôs state House and Senate. Though we have been assured that these maps will change over time, the approach used to draw the new lines is deeply troubling.

The process of splitting minority communities into separate districts, a tactic known as ‚Äúcracking‚Äù during gerrymander attempts, has long been used to prevent adequate representation from minoritie‚Ä¶

entry.title: "In legislative politics, there is a perception that...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In legislative politics, there is a perception that politicians must choose between getting things done and risking losing an election or slowing down to hold on to power. From the results of the last two elections and this legislative session, Democrats are looking to prove that to be a false choice in the minds of Colorado voters. We‚Äôll know if they were right or wrong in 2022."

What are your thoughts? Can Democrats be both both and victorious?

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.‚Äù

- 5280 Magazine

...
